page.title: 14PURSLOW SHOW, CLUNTON
page.content: Purslow Show is the big event of the year. It is always held on the Summer Bank Holiday Monday in a field lent by a farmer in Clunton. The show committee arrange the main show ring which this year included a Wild West show. It also includes grass track racing, gymknana and other sports and competitions as well as fancy dress. The organization of the produce tent is done by the Women's Institute starting several months in advance, revising and printing schedules and booking judges. The produce section includes the following classes; arts and crafts, flower arranging, cookery, store cupboard, garden produce and children's work from Clunbury School. Outside the tent a line of scarecrows compete for first prize in bird scaring (in the opinion of the judges that is, no-one asks the birds).
